summary: The document is a memorandum from the SSCIA (Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities) detailing an interview with John H. Stephens, who was involved in training the Cuban airborne brigade prior to the Bay of Pigs invasion. Stephens recounts being ordered to provide parachutes and weapons, including an 'assassination package', to individuals intended to be parachuted into Cuba to assassinate Fidel Castro. The training took place in Guatemala from 1959 until the invasion. Stephens' recollection includes the use of a special 9 mm 'assassination gun' among other armaments.
key_findings: John H. Stephens trained the Cuban airborne brigade in Guatemala before the Bay of Pigs invasion.
Stephens was involved in preparing 'assassination packages' for individuals intended to kill Fidel Castro.
The 'assassination package' included a variety of weapons, grenades, and a special 9 mm 'assassination gun'.
The training and assassination attempts occurred between 1959 and the Bay of Pigs invasion.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992
